Package Main.MVCTest

Class GameBoardControllerTest

java.lang.Object
Main.MVCTest.GameBoardControllerTest
class GameBoardControllerTest
extends java.lang.Object
GameBoardControllerTest tests to see if the methods of GameBoardController class are all working properly. The getters and setters of the other classes which have been tested and deemed to be in proper working condition are used to set up the test conditions for the tested methods because some methods tested do not give obvious results.

  • Field Details

    • gameBoard

      GameBoardController used in the tests.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoardControllerTest

      GameBoardControllerTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach void setUp()
      A new GameBoardController with new created parameters is created before every test.

    • tearDown

      @AfterEach void tearDown()
      The GameBoardController and its parameters are cleaned up after each test.

    • update

      @Test void update() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This tests the update method of the controller. The test returns true if the correct output is returned.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This test throws FileNotFoundException if HighScore lists do not exist.

    • moveLeft

      @Test void moveLeft()
      This tests the moveLeft method of the controller. The test returns true if the move amount of the player is -5.

    • moveRight

      @Test void moveRight()
      This tests the moveRight method of the controller. The test returns true if the move amount of the player is 5.

    • moveUp

      @Test void moveUp()
      This tests the moveUp method of the controller. The test returns true if the vertical move amount of the player is -5.

    • moveDown

      @Test void moveDown()
      This tests the moveDown method of the controller. The test returns true if the vertical move amount of the player is 5.

    • stop

      @Test void stop()
      This tests the stop method of the controller. The test returns true if the normal and vertical move amount of the player is 0 after stop method is applied for all 4 directions.

    • movePlayer

      @Test void movePlayer()
      This tests the movePlayer method of the controller. The test returns true if the player has moved the correct number of points in the vertical and horizontal directions after move methods are applied.

    • setBallSpeed

      @RepeatedTest(5) void setBallSpeed()
      This tests the setBallSpeed method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball speed is between -2 and 2 for the horizontal speed and -2 and 0 for the vertical speed. Since the method returns random values, we repeat the test 5 times.

    • addSpeedX

      @Test void addSpeedX()
      This tests the addSpeedX method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball horizontal speed increases by 1 after method is called. If speed is 4 which is the maximum speed, then nothing occurs.

    • minusSpeedX

      @Test void minusSpeedX()
      This tests the minusSpeedX method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball horizontal speed decreases by 1 after method is called. If speed is -4 which is the minimum speed, then nothing occurs.

    • addSpeedY

      @Test void addSpeedY()
      This tests the addSpeedY method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball vertical speed increases by 1 after method is called. If speed is 4 which is the maximum speed, then nothing occurs.

    • minusSpeedY

      @Test void minusSpeedY()
      This tests the minusSpeedY method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball vertical speed decreases by 1 after method is called. If speed is -4 which is the minimum speed, then nothing occurs.

    • reverseX

      @Test void reverseX()
      This tests the reverseX method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball horizontal speed is inverted after method is called. If ball has 0 horizontal speed, then nothing occurs.

    • reverseY

      @Test void reverseY()
      This tests the reverseY method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball vertical speed is inverted after method is called. If ball has 0 vertical speed, then nothing occurs.

    • moveBall

      @Test void moveBall()
      This tests the moveBall method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball has moved the correct number of points in the vertical and horizontal directions after move methods are applied.

    • reversePauseFlag

      @Test void reversePauseFlag()
      This tests the reversePauseFlag method of the controller. The test returns true if the controller performs the correct set of actions for both cases when game is paused and not paused.

    • returnPreviousLevelsScore

      @Test void returnPreviousLevelsScore()
      This tests the returnPreviousLevelsScore method of the controller. The test returns true if the correct score is returned for each level. If level 0 or negative levels are entered, then 0 is returned. If values greater than number of levels are entered, then ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • returnPreviousLevelsTime

      @Test void returnPreviousLevelsTime()
      This tests the returnPreviousLevelsTime method of the controller. The test returns true if the correct time is returned for each level. If level 0 or negative levels are entered, then 0 is returned. If values greater than number of levels are entered, then ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • calculateScoreAndTime

      @Test void calculateScoreAndTime()
      This tests the calculateScoreAndTime method of the controller. The test returns true if the correct score and time are returned for each level. If level 0, negative levels or values greater than number of levels are entered, then ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown. GodModeTimeLeft does not change because one second has not passed in the test.

    • resetTotalScoreAndTime

      @Test void resetTotalScoreAndTime()
      This tests the resetTotalScoreAndTime method of the controller. The test returns true if the correct score and time are returned for each level after each reset. If level 0 or negative levels are entered, then 0 is returned. If values greater than number of levels are entered, then ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • resetLevelScoreAndTime

      @Test void resetLevelScoreAndTime()
      This tests the resetLevelScoreAndTime method of the controller. The test returns true if the correct score and time are returned for each level after each reset. If negative levels or values greater than number of levels are entered, then ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • gameChecks

      @Test void gameChecks() throws java.io.IOException
      This tests the gameChecks method of the controller. The test returns true if correct output is returned.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This test throws IOException if audio file does not exist.

    • resetLevelData

      @Test void resetLevelData()
      This tests the resetLevelData method of the controller. The test returns true if the level data is reset.

    • nextLevel

      @Test void nextLevel()
      This tests the nextLevel method of the controller. The test returns true if the controller gives the correct set of outputs for both cases when trueProgression is true and false.

    • previousLevel

      @Test void previousLevel()
      This tests the previousLevel method of the controller. The test returns true if the controller gives the correct output for the method call.

    • ballReset

      @Test void ballReset()
      This tests the ballReset method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball and player are moved to the correct location and the ball speed and lost flag are reset.

    • ballMoveTo

      @Test void ballMoveTo()
      This tests the ballMoveTo method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball moves to the correct location.

    • playerMoveTo

      @Test void playerMoveTo()
      This tests the playerMoveTo method of the controller. The test returns true if the player moves to the correct location.

    • powerUpMoveTo

      @Test void powerUpMoveTo()
      This tests the powerUpMoveTo method of the controller. The test returns true if the power up moves to the correct location.

    • powerUpRandomSpawn

      @Test void powerUpRandomSpawn()
      This tests the powerUpRandomSpawn method of the controller. The test returns true if the power up spawns correctly.

    • powerUpCollected

      @Test void powerUpCollected()
      This tests the powerUpCollected method of the controller. The test returns true if the power up collected detection is correct for each case.

    • wallReset

      @Test void wallReset()
      This tests the wallReset method of the controller. The test returns true if the brick count and ball count are reset and all bricks are repaired.

    • resetBallCount

      @Test void resetBallCount()
      This tests the resetBallCount method of the controller. The test returns true if the ball count is reset.

    • repair

      @Test void repair()
      This tests the repair method of the controller. The test returns true if all bricks are repaired.

    • ballPlayerImpact

      @Test void ballPlayerImpact()
      This tests the ballPlayerImpact method of the controller. The test returns true if ball player impact is detected correctly for both cases. If there is impact, return true. If not, return false.

    • findImpacts

      @Test void findImpacts()
      This tests the findImpacts method of the controller. The test returns true all the possible impacts of the ball return the correct results.

    • findImpact

      @Test void findImpact()
      This tests the findImpact method of the controller. The test returns true if the direction of impact of the ball and brick is correctly returned. If brick is broken, then no impact occurs.

    • setImpact

      @Test void setImpact()
      This tests the setImpact method of the controller. The test returns true if the results from each impact are correct.
